member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AddAsCtorAttribute
member.summary: This attribute does not yet have an implemented generator. An attribute to indicate that the method of the attributed parameter should be added as a constructor of the class or structure of the type being annotated. The type must be partial and either a structure or class.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AddAsMemberAttribute
member.summary: This attribute does not yet have an implemented generator. An attribute to indicate that the method of the attributed parameter should be added as a member of the class or structure of the type being annotated. The type must be partial and either a structure or class.

remarks.para: This attribute indicates that the enclosing method can be added to the type of the attributed parameter. This is helpful when exposing member methods of handles and safe handles. For example, HEVENT has a number of supporting functions like bool SetEvent([In] HEVENT hEvent). Placing this attribute on the bool SetEvent([In, AddAsMember] HEVENT hEvent) parameter will then add bool SetEvent() to the HEVENT structure.

If there are supporting classes, like SafeEventHandle for HEVENT, then you can use the alternate parameter of the attribute to indicate that class name that should also receive the method (e.g., bool SetEvent([In, AddAsMember(typeof(SafeEventHandle))] HEVENT hEvent)).

member.name: M:Vanara.ByteSizeFormatter.TryParse(System.String,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a byte size to its 64-bit signed integer equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a byte size to convert.

When this method returns, contains the 64-bit signed integer value equivalent of the value contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null or Empty, or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.
member.returns: if was converted successfully; otherwise, .

member.returns: An of values, where each value represents the zero-based index of a bit that is set to in the bitmask.

The actual number of bytes read from the source. It can be set to IntPtr.Zero. In this case, this method does not provide the actual number of bytes read.
The actual number of bytes written to the destination. It can be set this to IntPtr.Zero. In this case, this method does not provide the actual number of bytes written.
member.returns: The actual number of bytes read ( ) and written ( ) from the source.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
buffer is a null reference.
offset or count is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.summary: Restricts access to a specified range of bytes in the stream.
member.param: Integer that specifies the byte offset for the beginning of the range.
Integer that specifies the length of the range, in bytes, to be restricted.
Specifies the restrictions being requested on accessing the range.
member.exception: The IO.Stream does not support locking.
member.remarks: This method is not used and always throws the exception.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.ComStream.System#Runtime#InteropServices#ComTypes#IStream#Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bytes from the stream object into memory starting at the current seek pointer.
member.param: The buffer which the stream data is read into.
The number of bytes of data to read from the stream object.
A pointer to a ULONG variable that receives the actual number of bytes read from the stream object. It can be set to IntPtr.Zero. In this case, this method does not return the number of bytes read.
member.returns: The actual number of bytes read ( ) from the source.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
buffer is a null reference.
offset or count is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.ComStream.System#Runtime#InteropServices#ComTypes#IStream#Revert
member.summary: Discards all changes that have been made to a transacted stream since the last stream.Commit call
member.exception: The IO.Stream does not support reverting.
member.remarks: This method is not used and always throws the exception.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.ComStream.System#Runtime#InteropServices#ComTypes#IStream#Seek(System.Int64,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes the seek pointer to a new location relative to the beginning of the stream, the end of the stream, or the current seek pointer
member.param: The displacement to be added to the location indicated by the dwOrigin parameter. If dwOrigin is STREAM_SEEK_SET, this is interpreted as an unsigned value rather than a signed value.

The origin for the displacement specified in dlibMove. The origin can be the beginning of the file (STREAM_SEEK_SET), the current seek pointer (STREAM_SEEK_CUR), or the end of the file (STREAM_SEEK_END).

The location where this method writes the value of the new seek pointer from the beginning of the stream. It can be set to IntPtr.Zero. In this case, this method does not provide the new seek pointer.
member.returns: Returns in the location where this method writes the value of the new seek pointer from the beginning of the stream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.ComStream.System#Runtime#InteropServices#ComTypes#IStream#SetSize(System.Int64)
member.summary: Changes the size of the stream object.
member.param: Specifies the new size of the stream as a number of bytes.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.ComStream.System#Runtime#InteropServices#ComTypes#IStream#Stat(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.STATSTG@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the STATSTG structure for this stream.
member.param: The STATSTG structure where this method places information about this stream object.

member.summary: Removes the access restriction on a range of bytes previously restricted with the LockRegion method.
member.param: Specifies the byte offset for the beginning of the range.
Specifies, in bytes, the length of the range to be restricted.
Specifies the access restrictions previously placed on the range.
member.exception: The IO.Stream does not support unlocking.

The number of bytes of data to attempt to write into the stream. This value can be zero.

A variable where this method writes the actual number of bytes written to the stream object. The caller can set this to IntPtr.Zero, in which case this method does not provide the actual number of bytes written.
member.returns: The actual number of bytes written ( ).
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

member.name: T:Vanara.InteropServices.ISafeMemoryHandleBase
member.summary: Defines the base functionality for a safe memory handle, providing methods and properties for managing allocated memory.
member.remarks: This interface represents a safe memory handle that supports operations such as copying memory, retrieving bytes, locking, and unlocking. It is designed to abstract memory management in scenarios where direct memory manipulation is required. Implementations of this interface may provide additional functionality, such as span-based access or event handling.

member.summary: Methods for working with unions in unmanaged structures.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.UnionHelper.GetArrayItemAtOffset``2(``1,Vanara.PInvoke.SizeT)
member.summary: Retrieves an item of type from an unmanaged structure of type at the specified offset index.
member.remarks: This method is intended for use with unmanaged types only. The caller must ensure that the types and are compatible and that the memory layout of allows for indexing into its contents as an array of .
member.typeparam: The type of the item to retrieve.
The type of the original unmanaged structure.
member.param: The original unmanaged structure from which the item is retrieved.
The zero-based offset index of the item to retrieve. Must be within the bounds of the structure.
member.returns: The item of type located at the specified offset index within the original structure.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of items of type that can fit within the original structure.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.UnionHelper.GetValueAtOffset``2(``1,Vanara.PInvoke.SizeT)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of type located at the specified offset within the memory of the unmanaged structure .
member.remarks: This method performs an unsafe memory operation to retrieve the value at the specified offset. Ensure that the offset is valid and within the bounds of the memory layout of .
member.typeparam: The type of the value to retrieve. Must be an unmanaged type.
The type of the original structure. Must be an unmanaged type.
member.param: The original structure from which the value is retrieved.
The byte offset within the memory of the original structure where the value is located.
member.returns: The value of type at the specified offset.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of .

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.UnionHelper.SetArrayItemAtOffset``2(``1@,Vanara.PInvoke.SizeT,``0)
member.summary: Sets the value of an array-like item at the specified offset within a structure.
member.remarks: This method operates on unmanaged types and uses unsafe code to directly manipulate memory. The caller must ensure that the structure and types are compatible and that the index is within bounds.
member.typeparam: The type of the item to set. Must be an unmanaged type.
The type of the original structure containing the array-like data. Must be an unmanaged type.
member.param: A reference to the original structure containing the array-like data.
The zero-based index of the item to set within the structure.
The value to set at the specified index.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of items that can fit within the original structure.

member.name: M:Vanara.InteropServices.UnionHelper.SetValueAtOffset``2(``1@,Vanara.PInvoke.SizeT,``0)
member.summary: Sets the value of a specified type at a given byte offset within an unmanaged structure.
member.remarks: This method uses unsafe code to directly manipulate memory. Ensure that the offset is valid and does not exceed the size of the original structure. Improper use of this method can lead to memory corruption or undefined behavior.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to set. Must be an unmanaged type.
The type of the original structure. Must be an unmanaged type.
member.param: The original structure in which the value will be set.
The byte offset within the structure where the value will be set. Must be within the bounds of the structure.
The value to set at the specified offset.
member.exception: Thrown if is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the original structure.

member.name: T:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant
member.summary: The integer expression formed from one or more of these constants determines the type of reading or writing operations permitted. It is formed by combining one or more constants with a translation-mode constant.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_RDONLY
member.summary: Opens file for reading only; if this flag is given, neither _O_RDWR nor _O_WRONLY can be given.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_WRONLY
member.summary: Opens file for writing only; if this flag is given, neither _O_RDONLY nor _O_RDWR can be given.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_RDWR
member.summary: Opens file for both reading and writing; if this flag is given, neither _O_RDONLY nor _O_WRONLY can be given.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_APPEND
member.summary: Repositions the file pointer to the end of the file before every write operation.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_CREAT
member.summary: Creates and opens a new file for writing; this has no effect if the file specified by filename exists.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_TRUNC
member.summary: Opens and truncates an existing file to zero length; the file must have write permission. The contents of the file are destroyed. If this flag is given, you cannot specify _O_RDONLY.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_EXCL
member.summary: Returns an error value if the file specified by filename exists. Only applies when used with _O_CREAT.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_TEXT
member.summary: Opens a file in text (translated) mode. (For more information, see Text and Binary Mode File I/O and fopen.)

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_BINARY
member.summary: Opens the file in binary (untranslated) mode. (See fopen for a description of binary mode.)

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_WTEXT
member.summary: Opens a file in Unicode mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_U16TEXT
member.summary: Opens a file in Unicode UTF-16 mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_U8TEXT
member.summary: Opens a file in Unicode UTF-8 mode.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_NOINHERIT
member.summary: Prevents creation of a shared file descriptor.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_TEMPORARY
member.summary: Creates a file as temporary; the file is deleted when the last file descriptor is closed. The pmode argument is required when _O_CREAT is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_SHORT_LIVED
member.summary: Creates a file as temporary and if possible does not flush to disk. The pmode argument is required when _O_CREAT is specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_OBTAIN_DIR
member.summary: get information about a directory

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_SEQUENTIAL
member.summary: Specifies that caching is optimized for, but not restricted to, sequential access from disk.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileOpConstant._O_RANDOM
member.summary: Specifies that caching is optimized for, but not restricted to, random access from disk.

member.name: T:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant
member.summary: These constants specify the current attributes of the file or directory specified by the function.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_NORMAL
member.summary: Normal. File can be read or written to without restriction.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_RDONLY
member.summary: Read-only. File cannot be opened for writing, and a file with the same name cannot be created.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_HIDDEN
member.summary: Hidden file. Not normally seen with the DIR command, unless the /AH option is used. Returns information about normal files as well as files with this attribute.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_SYSTEM
member.summary: System file. Not normally seen with the DIR command, unless the /AS option is used.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_SUBDIR
member.summary: Subdirectory.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FileAttributeConstant._A_ARCH
member.summary: Archive. Set whenever the file is changed, and cleared by the BACKUP command.

member.name: T:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant
member.summary: These constants are used to indicate file type in the st_mode field of the _stat structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IFMT
member.summary: File type mask

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IFDIR
member.summary: Directory

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IFCHR
member.summary: Character special

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IFIFO
member.summary: Pipe

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IFREG
member.summary: Regular

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IREAD
member.summary: Read permission, owner

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IWRITE
member.summary: Write permission, owner

member.name: F:Vanara.RunTimeLib.FilePermissionConstant._S_IEXEC
member.summary: Execute/search permission, owner

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.
member.remarks: To override a method that has a parameter annotated with this attribute, use the ? operator. For example: override ISet<Enum> ReadJson(JsonReader reader, Type objectType, ISet<Enum>? existingValue, bool hasExistingValue, JsonSerializer serializer). For more information, see Nullable static analysis in the C# guide.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: T:System.Range
member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.
member.remarks: Construct a Range object using the start and end indexes.
member.param: Represent the inclusive start index of the range.
Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: M:System.Range.#ctor(System.Index,System.Index)
member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.
member.remarks: Construct a Range object using the start and end indexes.
member.param: Represent the inclusive start index of the range.
Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: P:System.Range.Start
member.summary: Represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:System.Range.End
member.summary: Represent the exclusive end index of the Range.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.
